intro: Bupleurum karglii f. strictum, commonly known as the Alpine silvery bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine layer of silver hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
